text: Thomas Brett (born 13 November 1989), known as Tom Brett, is an English cricketer who played for Northamptonshire County Cricket Club. He is a right- handed batsman and slow left arm orthodox bowler. He has played for Bedfordshire County Cricket Club since 2008. Brett made his first-class cricket debut against Oxford MCCU at the start of the 2010 season. He then went on to play a number of One day games at the end of the season. Brett made a total of six List A and two first-class appearances for Northamptonshire.Tom Brett, CricInfo. Retrieved 2018-04-01. At the end of the 2011 season he was released. Away from England, Brett took 52 A grade wickets in the WACA competition for Joondalup Districts Cricket Club in Western Australia between 2008-2010. Brett continued to make Second XI appearances for Northants until the end of the 2013 season and returned to play for Bedfordshire after being released by Northants.Tom Brett, CricketArchive. Retrieved 2018-04-01. He took 39 wickets in six games for Bedfordshire in the 2017 Minor Counties Championship season including a career best 8/87. At the end of the 2017 season he played for Derbyshire's Second XI. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1989 births Category:English cricketers of the 21st century Category:English cricketers Category:Living people Category:Northamptonshire cricketers Category:Sportspeople from Kettering Category:Bedfordshire cricketers
title: Tom Brett
